== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee was born in Los Angeles, California.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Her father, Daniel McPhee, was a television producer.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Her mother, Peisha (née Burch) McPhee, has been a vocal coach on American Idol since 2011.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: The family moved to the Sherman Oaks neighborhood of Los Angeles when she was 12 years old.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Peisha McPhee recognized her daughter's musical talent and decided to train her.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee's older sister, Adriana, has been a vocal coach on American Idol since 2012.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee is of English, Irish, Scottish, and German descent.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She attended Boston Conservatory for three semesters, majoring in musical theatre.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She left college before graduation on the advice of her manager, and returned to Los Angeles to try out for television pilots.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee was cast (during the time she had dropped out of college and was auditioning in Los Angeles) in a mall-based MTV soap opera pilot, You Are Here, playing the older sister of a more popular younger sister.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: MTV never aired the pilot and did not pick up the series.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In March 2005, McPhee starred as Annie Oakley in a Cabrillo Music Theater production of the musical Annie Get Your Gun.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee was nominated for a Los Angeles Stage Ovation Award in the category of "Lead Actress in a Musical".
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee had a small role as Paramount Girl in the 2007 musical film Crazy, based on the life of Hank Garland.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee filmed the role in early 2005, before she auditioned for American Idol.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee has struggled with eating disorders.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She told People that at age 13, she began starving herself and exercising compulsively, and at age 17, became bulimic.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee gained weight in college due to her bingeing.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After seven years of illness, she finally entered a three-month rehabilitation program after successfully passing her American Idol audition; her rehab stint ended just before the Idol semifinals started in February 2006.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: During her run on American Idol, she lost 30 lb (14 kg) due to eating better as part of her treatment.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She told Teen Vogue in May 2007, "I eat whatever I crave—I'm just really careful about portions."
section: == Early life ==

sentences: McPhee and her sister appeared on the debut of The Dr. Keith Ablow Show on September 18, 2006, to discuss her struggles with bulimia and her childhood fear of her father.

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: After dating for three years, on February 2, 2008, McPhee married Nick Cokas at Beverly Hills Presbyterian Church.

sentences: In October 2013, she was photographed publicly kissing her married Smash director, Michael Morris.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On May 22, 2014, McPhee filed for divorce from Cokas, after "having been separated for the past year".
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Her divorce from Cokas was finalized on February 8, 2016.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: McPhee dated her Scorpion co-star Elyes Gabel for almost two years.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They split in 2016.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She became engaged to record producer David Foster in June 2018.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They married a year later on June 28, 2019, at the St. Yeghiche Armenian Apostolic Church in Kensington, London.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She gave birth to a son named Rennie David Foster on February 22, 2021.
